content: Malaysian businessman **Tan Sri Dol Ramli** (1922 - 2011, 88 years old) was a [Malaysian](/wiki/Malaysian_people) who is a former Director General of Broadcasting at [Radio Malaya](/wiki/Radio_in_Malaysia) and also the founder of [Radio Televisyen Malaysia](/wiki/Radio_Televisyen_Malaysia) (RTM). ## Background Dol Ramli was born on October 3, 1922, on Dunlop Street, Singapore. He married Che Kamila Marzuki and had five sons. He attended the [University of Malaya](/wiki/University_of_Malaya), where he studied history. At the end of his life in 2011 he had 11 grandchildren and two great -grandchildren. ## Career [Tan Sri](/wiki/Tan_Sri) Dol began his career as a newspaper journalist in [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) at Radio Malaya 1948â€“1954, becoming Director in 1955 and serving in the position until 1975. He was the General Manager of the state-run [Bernama](/wiki/Bernama) news agency from 1975 to 1980. From there he became Director-General of Radio Malaya. Dol Ramli was the lyricist of the song Bahasa Jiwa Bangsa. ## Books This article **lacks [ISBNs](/wiki/ISBN) for books it lists**.
